articles.description: The flightless Aldabra rail went extinct 136,000 years ago when its atoll home sank beneath the waves. Then it evolved again.
articles.content:
Name: Aldabra rail (Dryolimnas cuvieri aldabranus)
Where it lives: Aldabra — a coral atoll off the southeast coast of Africa
What it eats: Insects
Why it's awesome: Lying off the southeast coast o… [+2508 chars]
